questions.question: What is the title of the supplementary information?
questions.answer: Structural and electronic switching of a single crystal 2D metal-organic framework prepared by chemical vapor deposition

questions.question: What method was used for the growth of MOF single crystals?
What is the chemical formula of the material discussed in the study?
What was the effect of exposing the MOF to DMA vapor?
questions.answer: It facilitated the conversion of the MOF structure from 1 to 2, changing its color from orange-red to dark red.

questions.question: Is the conversion between MOF structures 1 and 2 reversible?
What was the observed change in conductivity upon conversion of the MOF structure from 1 to 2?
questions.answer: There was a 30-fold increase in conductivity.

questions.question: What technique was used to analyze the molecular-level assembly of Mo2(INA)4?
What was the response of the MOF device to optical illumination?
questions.answer: The device produced a significant and cyclable photocurrent response.

questions.question: Can the MOF discussed in the study be considered a two-dimensional, single-molecule thick framework?
What potential applications are suggested for the MOF based on its properties?
Was the MOF capable of undergoing structural transitions at room temperature?
What was the role of methanol vapor in the study?
questions.answer: It was used to convert the MOF structure from 2 back to 1.

questions.question: What was the primary building unit in the MOF discussed?
Did the study demonstrate the direct growth of large-area, high-quality MOF single crystals?
What was the significance of the Moâ€“Mo bond lengths mentioned in the study?
questions.answer: They were consistent with those previously reported in quadruple-bonded Mo2 cores, indicating the integrity of the Mo2(INA)4 clusters.

questions.question: What was the effect of higher temperatures or lower pressures during the CVD process?
Was the MOF's electrical conductivity tunable?
What was the role of the Kavli Energy NanoSciences Institute in the study?
questions.answer: The affiliation is mentioned, but the specific role in the study is not detailed in the provided text.

questions.question: Did the study involve the use of a homebuilt CVD system?
What was the impact of the study's findings on the field of metal-organic frameworks?
questions.answer: The study demonstrated the potential for gas-phase methods in the preparation of high-quality MOFs and their integration into devices.
